interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Baron Baptiste's Power Yoga Level 2 Review Date: 2003/11/08 Store: Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Exercise & Fitness Product Description: ['A great yoga training DVD'] Average Rating: 4.0 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Exercise & Fitness', 'Format': 'NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Baptiste, Baron', 'Language': 'English', 'Publication Date': 'August 5, 2003', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Package Dimensions': '7.1 x 5.42 x 0.58 inches; 2.88 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'NTSC', 'Release date': 'August 5, 2003', 'Actors': 'Baptiste, Baron', 'Studio': 'Good Times Video'} Review Text: I purchased this because I had viewed the PBS Journey Into Power program and was intrigued. The DVD is a Goodtimes production and the first part of the "program" is a commercial for their other products. You can't just skip to the workout, which I found annoying. The actual practice begins with Baron explaining how yoga will improve your life,etc. Again, you can't skip ahead here, either. When the practice actually starts, it turns out to be a set, with everyone ( all under 25 yrs. and very fit) in white Danskin yoga-gear. The music is eighties - ish and as loud as Baron is, so it's distracting. No one appears to be doing any modifications so those just beginning may injure themselves trying to keep up.
If you're looking for a 'power yoga' practice that you can grow with, I highly recommend David Swenson's Short Forms tape or DVD (also available at amazon) as the best to begin with. It has three workouts that are suitable for the beginner and the advanced practitioner, and a great guided relaxation. His book is a must have, too. The Flow series, featuring Tracey Rich and Ganga White, is also an excellent production that is beautifully produced, can be tailored to your level and never gets 'old'. Review Title: Difficult to view and practice with. Rating: 1.0 --------------------------------------------------

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Fitness Focus**: User actively engages with yoga and exercise content, particularly power yoga. They have an interest in both beginner-friendly and advanced practices.
- **Content Preference**: Prefers DVDs that provide clear instruction and multiple workout options. Values guided relaxation and modifications for various skill levels to avoid injury.
- **Quality Expectations**: Discontent with poorly structured content that mixes promotional material with workout routines. They favor productions that are well-produced, visually appealing, and tailored to different levels.
- **Music Sensitivity**: Finds distracting music to be a negative aspect of workout videos. Preference for unobtrusive music that complements the instructional content.
- **Alternatives Recommended**: Tends to suggest alternatives based on personal experiences, indicating a proactive approach to finding the best resources for fitness improvement.

In summary, the user opts for high-quality, structured fitness programming that caters to all skill levels while providing engaging and supportive content.
